title: Fix prod deploy script and clippy
Adding more site setup vars. Fixes #678
Dont append ? to url when cleaning it
Fixing ResolveObject API and unit tests
Rewrite remaining activities
body: This is my last major PR for 0.12, main parts of the apub code refactor are done and everything should work correctly now (pending testing). There are still things which need to be changed, but those are all internal and can be done later (like rewriting fetcher).

title: Adding ModTransferCommunity to modlog in API. Fixes #1437
body:
How transfer communities will look after this fix:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/930215/129805714-9890df02-97e3-426a-baa2-c96317cd5a3d.png)

title: Swap out iframely
body: This is obviously missing embed codes, IE `embed_html` in our DB, but I greatly doubt they were used much anyway (and they're a security risk).

title: Make sure bots aren't included in aggregate counts
Don't allow deleted users to do actions. Fixes #1656
Update lemmy_api_client status in README
body: The Dart client is now fully up to date with the JS client and is updated every time a new feature appears. It also exposes websocket joins, so it is currently feature complete.

title: When banning a user, remove communities they've created
Rewrite activitypub following, person, community, pm
Migrate comment inReplyTo field to single value (ref #1454)
body:
This is how we can do protocol migrations now with the new way of sending and receiving apub objects. I think its very elegant.

Tested by inspecting the json, and by temporarily changing the code to send the new variant (works fine).

title: Simplify config dess
body: You can diff the changes that I made in the merge, mainly in request.rs

title: Some comment count fixes.
body:
- Make sure an update to deleted decreases the count. Fixes #1676
- Don't allow the post creator to comment necro-bump their own post.
  Fixes #1675

title: Rewrite comment
body: Continuing the previous rewrite, and getting rid of some copy-pasted code.

title: Blank out extra info for deleted or removed content. Fixes #1679
body:
I don't *particularly* like this solution, as this blanking happens after the database calls, so requires some in-code manipulation, when I'd really rather have the DB be able to do it. But there's no way that I can think of to do that, IE blanking other columns if one is a certain result.

The vector looping if probably fast enough that it's not an issue.

title: Rewrite apub post (de)serialization using structs (ref #1657)
body: Main change here is in objects/post.rs, which uses a struct instead of `PageExt` to (de)serialize the apub json. This makes the whole thing much simpler, and verification of mod actions (sticky/lock post) are handled better now. The other changes (mainly in activities/post/ and activity_queue.rs) are necessary to make the post.rs changes work.

title: Remove brotli, zstd dependencies
body: These are for http compression which we dont need. They take 141s and 124s to compile on my laptop, respectively. So this is gonna give a big compilation speedup especially on slower devices. I also added a CI check so we dont accidentally pull them in again.

title: Distribute Lemmy via crates.io
body:
This is a much better way to distribute Lemmy for native (dockerless) installation, as it avoids having to clone the git repository. I already pushed our code to [crates.io/crates/lemmy_server](https://crates.io/crates/lemmy_server). Note that the code there is not an actual RC, but simply the last commit on main (so it definitely shouldnt be used in production yet).

Assuming that you already have postgres and cargo installed and configured, installing Lemmy is as simple as:
```
cargo install lemmy_server --version 0.11.3-rc.5
mkdir -p lemmy/config
echo -e "{\n  hostname: example.com\n}" > config/config.hjson
lemmy_server
```

Todo:
- [x] ~~Contact crates.io support to increase publishing rate limit (we have too many crates)~~
    - not necessary, the rate limit is high enough (i just uploaded too many crates and versions while testing)
- [x] Improve cargo-publish.sh script
- [ ] Add more [package metadata](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html) (authors, keywords, categories etc)
- [ ] Run cargo-publish.sh in CI for releases
- [ ] Rewrite documentation to use cargo install
- [ ] Maybe get lemmy-ui published on npmjs.com
- [ ] Try to get pictrs published on crates.io

title: Fix issue with protocol string in actor id generation
Move resolving of activitypub objects to separate api endpoint
body:
Test with:
```
curl -G -X GET -d "q=!main@lemmy-gamma:8561" http://localhost:8540/api/v3/resolve_object | jq
curl -G -X GET -d "q=http://lemmy-beta:8541/post/1" http://localhost:8540/api/v3/resolve_object | jq
etc
```

We can use this opportunity to move the functionality to a separate place in lemmy-ui, which should make it easier to discover and explain. Not sure exactly where that should be though.

This is a breaking change (maybe we should just create a label for that).

title: Adding shortname fetching for users and communities. Fixes #1662
Merge apub, apub_receive crates
body: Splitting them like this doesnt make sense anymore, as we will use the same structs from #1652 for activity sending, so send and receive parts need to be in the same crate.

title: Apub inbox rewrite
body:
I finally found a good way to handle routing for incoming Activitypub messages, which can be type checked at compile time. It also makes the whole code a lot simpler and shorter (this isnt visible from the line count, as its now split over more files, so there are more imports). 

After getting the routing sorted out with a (very shitty) derive macro, I still have to rework security checks, fix federation tests, and check that all activities work.

This is the first part in a major rewrite of the activitypub code. Before it can be released as part of a new major version (0.12), I need to make at least two more major changes:

- Rewrite activity sending code to use the same structs, by adding a method `ActivityHandler.send()`
- Add a newtype `Id<ObjectType>`, which wraps Url and allows dereferencing it into a Post, Community or other objects. This will give better type safety and less code duplication. Will require a rewrite of fetching code.

Later I plan to publish a high-level activitypub library based on the abstracted code extracted from Lemmy. 

@asonix This might be interesting to you.

title: User / community blocking. Fixes #426
body:
There are several breaking API changes, which are more easily viewed here: https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy-js-client/pull/22

I'll review this now to go over the main changes.
